intro: Gymnosporia boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian burr bush, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny branches. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, three-lobed fruits. Gymnosporia boliviana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various local fauna.
